Entries.DialogueText: My husband Kent is a soldier, working overseas. That's why he's not here right now.
I know he'll come back safe once his tour is over!!
Need something?
Ah... You sure you want to give away such a precious item? Well, thank you!
They say the bus is back up and running. I'm sure Pam is happy about that...
I heard she'd been drinking more after losing her job... so hopefully this helps.
I heard about you and Sam. Hopefully he won't cause you any trouble!
Poor Clint... they say he's head-over-heels for Emily, but I've heard she only thinks of him as a friend...
Penny's a sweet girl. She's been Vincent's teacher for a while now, and he really loves her.
*whisper* Did you hear about Shane? That's so terrible... I hope he's doing okay.
I've been doing aerobics class with the ladies every week...
Recently, someone new joined the class, but he made us all swear we wouldn't reveal his identity!
Thanks again for bringing that fish! It was some of the best we've had in a while.
I should count my blessings more often. We have a good life here. Some people don't have enough food to eat.
Caroline and I are good friends. I tell her everything.
When you become a parent, you have to leave your old lifestyle behind.
Maybe that's not entirely true... but if you're not careful, it will happen.
Maybe I've spoiled the boys a bit. They've never had to do any chores.
I guess I want them to be able to enjoy their childhood while they still can. Well, Sam's basically a man now, though.
I hope he hasn't grown up to be lazy. That won't do.
Being a parent isn't very easy.
Is Sam just bumming around the farm, or is he contributing?

Joja#The food at JojaMart might not be the healthiest for my family, but with such low prices you'd be crazy to shop anywhere else!|The food at Pierre's is so much fresher and healthier than anything I ever bought at JojaMart. I do miss those cheap Joja prices, though.
Are you alright? We've never seen anything like this before...
I wish my husband was here. He'd know exactly what to do.
Vincent got up early to go play in the rain. I just hope they're right about it being completely harmless!
Oh! You aren't exactly how I imagined... but that's okay! I'm Jodi.
It's a quiet little town, so it's very exciting when someone new moves in! Having a farmer around could really change things.
I'm so happy for you and Sam. I think you two are the perfect match!
I never thought I'd say it... but I'll miss those awful noises from Sam's guitar...
Maintaining a household is difficult work... but somebody has to do it.
Yes?
kent#Yesterday I visited Yoba's Altar to give thanks for my husband's safe return.|Yesterday I visited Yoba's Altar to ask for my husband's safe return.
I'm trying to stay positive, but it's hard sometimes.
It's nice to have a family... but I'd be lying if I said I never miss the freedom of being young...
Wow... I heard what you did for Pam... Boy, I wonder what she did to get in your good graces like that?
...I wish I had that kind of money to throw around...
Did you see Pam's new house? Boy... I wish I had that kind of money... I'd love to get the kitchen remodeled, at least...
What's this? It looks like one of Kent's buddies from the war. Maybe you should show it to him?
The view is breathtaking! Deep blue as far as the eye can see...
We all love it when Gus shows up.
What a treat!
I think I'll make seafood tonight.
Hi.
I'm so glad you're trying to improve that old farm.
Once you've got everything in order, it's going to add a lot to our community!
It's going to be a lot of work for you, though.
Bye.
Summer is nice, but it also means more work.
I'll have to keep the garden in shape on top of working in the house!
What in the world am I going to make for dinner?
*sigh*...
Housework is frustrating because you're never finished.
The day after I sweep the floor, it's dirty again.
Hello.
Do you need something? I'm a little busy.
How's my little Sammy doing on the old farm?
I'm taking a break from house chores today.
I'm taking the day off.
If I don't spend any time outside, I'll go crazy!
Plus I don't want my legs to turn soft.
I had a dream that I had complete freedom, no obligation to anyone but myself...
...Then I woke up and realized I had a full day of house chores ahead of me...
But I don't regret having a family, ... Sam and Vincent mean everything to me!
So you're a farmer, huh? Interesting.
I've never met a farmer before.
Maybe some day you can teach me how to grow vegetables.
Where does all the time go? *sigh*
I remember when Sam was a little baby wearing diapers. He was such a cute little kid.
Don't tell him I said that.
You must really like talking to me, huh?
Exercise is important for staying healthy. I always make sure to set aside some time for it.
As a parent, I don't have much time to devote to myself. So I try and make every minute count.
What did you say? It's already? My goodness!
I still have tons of work to do!
I wish I could spend more time outside, but there's so much work to do.
I started wearing rubber gloves to keep my hands soft.
The older you get, the more work you have to do to stay healthy.
Ok, bye!
It would be nice to take a vacation once in a while...
I loved playing in the snow when I was a kid. The great thing about being a mother is that I get to enjoy it again.
If I was rich the first thing I'd do would be to hire a maid and a chef.
My goodness, that would be nice!
Sam makes a lot of noise with that music of his. I hope it doesn't disturb the neighbors.
How's Sam doing? I have to admit, there's less cooking and cleaning to do since he moved out...
We kind of rushed into our marriage, with Kent being a soldier and all... I hardly got a taste of youth and freedom, and now it's too late to ever go back.
I can't believe I'm saying this to you.
Hi. Do you get tired of people asking about your farm all the time?
I think I would.
*sigh*... Sometimes I dream about life on my own... without a family to look after. Is that horrible?
Don't tell anyone.
What do I do for fun? Hmm... That's a good question.
I like sleeping.
Kent has been home for a while now, but he still seems uneasy.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Farm/93/f Jodi 1000/t 600 930/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun
Entries.DialogueText: *puff* ...hi ! *pant* Whew... that was quite a workout, walking all the way up here.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Farm/93/f Jodi 1000/t 600 930/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_1
Entries.DialogueText: Anyway... I came by to ask if you wanted to have dinner with us tonight!

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Farm/93/f Jodi 1000/t 600 930/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_1_1
Entries.DialogueText: You don't have to... but if you decide to come, could you please bring a largemouth bass with you?

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Farm/93/f Jodi 1000/t 600 930/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_1_2
Entries.DialogueText: ...that's right. One of those big, slimy fish from the lake. I need one for the casserole I'm making.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Farm/93/f Jodi 1000/t 600 930/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_1_3
Entries.DialogueText: Okay, well... it'll be at our house at around 7:00 PM tonight... don't forget the largemouth bass! Bye.

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Farm/93/f Jodi 1000/t 600 930/d Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun_implied
Entries.DialogueText: Fish casserole always hits the spot.
Hi, ! I'm just making some popcorn.
But, dear... popcorn was always your favorite before you left.
*whisper* ... can you say something to him?
It's okay, dear.
The last thing I want to do is make you upset. I'll do my best to keep your spirits up from now on.
I'm glad you're a friend of the family, . Sorry about my behavior before.
What was that sound?
*gasp*
This is absolutely terrible! What happened?
80#Thanks for telling me the truth, . It's not such a big deal.|You did WHAT, Sam?! What's gotten into you?!
Thanks, honey.
81#I'm angry at you. I have no idea why you lied like that.|Sorry about what happened earlier.
Oh hi, ! Come in! Do I smell fresh fish?
Sam! Could you come in here and help with dinner?
Wow, this looks like quality bass, . Thanks so much for bringing this.
Mmm... that crispy bass was delicious! The breading was out of this world...
I almost feel like part of the family, now.
Ah, I'm so glad you came, ! And you brought the fish! Wonderful.
Sam! Could you come in here and help clean this fish?
Wow, it looks wonderful... and it smells so fresh! Thanks so much for doing this, .
Kent caught a fish, too, but he eats about a whole fish to himself!
I overheard the price... that's outrageous! You should be ashamed.
No way!

Entries.DialogueFrom: Event:Town/191393/Hn ccFishTank/Hn ccBulletin/Hn ccPantry/Hn ccVault/Hn ccBoilerRoom/Hn ccCraftsRoom/Hl jojaFishTank/Hl jojaPantry/Hl jojaVault/Hl jojaBoilerRoom/Hl jojaCraftsRoom/Hl JojaMember/w sunny/H_alt
Entries.DialogueText: Boycott!
Sam? I'm coming in!
What's wrong, Honey? Were you doing something... bad?
I thought I heard some weird sounds coming from your room...
Oh! *giggle*... That explains why you're all red and sweaty.
Okay, well good luck. I'll see you in the morning.
Oh no...
Yum!
Hi... did you sell {1} {2} to the general store the other day? I think I bought it...
It was pretty high-quality stuff. As soon as I smelled it I was back in Granny's old cottage...
Hi... did you sell {1} {2} to the fish shop the other day? I think I bought it...
It was pretty high-quality stuff. Very firm meat.
He doesn't look very happy... I guess Mayor Lewis had to cut costs with a budget clown this year.
Oh no. Who's responsible for littering here?Every year we get some tourists that don't respect our town...
Vincent's upset that I won't let him go into the haunted maze... but he's just a little boy!
Sam took Vincent into the maze. I hope they're okay...
Vincent loves this festival... it's a joy to see him so happy.
Kent always seems a little antsy during big gatherings like this...
Are you going to be dancing today, ?
I have special earrings I only wear once a year for this event.They're little daffodils... see?
I hope the soup is good this year.
I've heard the summer season gets very busy for farmers. Make sure you don't overwork yourself!
There! I just saw something glowing!Oh... It's gone.
The full moon will guide the jellies to our shore.
It's not a good time of year for a diet...
This spot is for the overflow presents. There's just too many to count this year!
The forest looks beautiful in the winter, doesn't it?
Gatherings like this are a good way to build community with our neighbors.It's nice how cold weather seems to bring people together.
Oh, you're such a sweetheart! I really love this!
Thank you! This makes my day really special.
Hmm, well I guess I could always put this in the compost...
*Blech*... I hate this...
That's so nice of you! Thanks.
